short_summary: purchase, delivery and installation of Lockers
full_summary:
### Government Tender Announcement 
#### Request for Proposal: Lockers
#### Solicitation Number: WS3684950650
#### Publication Date: October 14, 2022

The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) on behalf of the Canadian Food Inspection Agency invites you to submit a proposal for the purchase, delivery, and installation of lockers.

**Key Dates andTimes:**

* **Tender Closing Date:** January 5, 2023, at 2:00 PM Eastern Standard Time (EST)
* **Expected Contract Start Date:** October 27, 2022
* **Expected Contract End Date:** April 30, 2023

**Proposal Requirements:**

* All required supporting documentation and bid submission must be submitted by the tender closing date and time.
* Late bids will be declared non-responsive.

**Project Context:**

The PSPC, on behalf of the Canadian Food Inspection Agency, is seeking the purchase, delivery, and installation of lockers.

**Trade Agreements:**

* Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)

**Geographic Location:**

* The project will be delivered in Edmonton, Alberta

**Contact Information:**

Send inquiries and proposals to:
Abou Ahmad, Kassan
Kassan.Abo-uahmad@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca

**Notice URL:**

http://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/14370015?extsite=MTQzNzAwMTVfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==

Note to the writer: 
To make this announcement more engaging, avoid the use of jargon and inclusion of every bit of information added in the as sent contractor's email. It is vital to rephrase and rewrite the information added to make it easy to understand and connect the most important pieces of information together.
Ensure that the new entry demonstrates professionalism - stay concise and try to convey the necessary details effectively. Use subheadings to break up the information for better readability. 
Most importantly ensure that the dates you reuse from the original contract are are correct. 
Let me know when you are done so I can review the output. 

---

### Revised Feedback and Review  - February 6, 2023:
There are minimal edits I require from the above version. 

Fully approve the output.

Keep up the great work. 

To your notes:

* You clarified the tender closing date to abbreviate hours.  - Check Canadian industrial bid submission hours are regarded
